attributes.action: More protection for Transport Of London (TFL) workers
attributes.additional_details:
They are not just making a "heroic effort" they are risking their own lives!. 
Some drivers were not being provided with enough protective gear such as face masks, gloves, or hands sanitizer.  
We believe the government can do MORE for TFL staff. They should provide at least enough protective gear to keep them safe while they’re risking their lives taking key workers to their place of work, like the lovely NHS staff, drivers are also essential for day to day. They move london!
attributes.background: As everyone should be aware, 3 drivers and 2 controllers have died after contracting Covid-19.  We want to ask the government to take all the necessary measures to protect bus drivers and all those who are exposed to maximum risk by Covid-19.

rejection.details:
The Greater London Authority, not the UK Government or House of Commons, is responsible for Transport for London.

The Government has published safer transport guidance for operators: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/coronavirus-covid-19-safer-transport-guidance-for-operators/coronavirus-covid-19-safer-transport-guidance-for-operators

Implementing this guidance is a matter for individual transport operators, such as TfL, and not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Provide Protective Personal Equipment PPE to all Transports Workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317297

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
